alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 26 at 6:02AM EST until January 26 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch for a storm total of 6 to 12 inches and ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Piscataquis, Northern Washington, and Central Penobscot Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile due to falling and blowing snow. The strong winds and weight of snow on tree limbs may down power lines and could cause sporadic power outages. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.

area.areaDesc: Central Penobscot; Northern Washington; Southern Piscataquis
